page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY In 1793 the{Duke of Buccleuch}founded the model village of{Newcastleton.}The crofts and small holdings were cleared to make way for the three farm. Copshaha at the north end,Copshaw in the middle and Copshaw Park at the south end. This is the reason for {Newcastleton's}nickname of Copshawholm. {Newcastleton}was intended as a {weaving}community and the people worked the looms in their own home.Those who built a single storey house were allowed 1 acre of land on the hillside which is now part of the Golf Course.
